results.title: T'es grand et puis t'oublies = When you grow up, you'll forget
results.brief_description:
In 1965, Henri, a young orphan, is sent to holiday camp, very much against his wish to stay in town with his elder sister. His relationship with his camp mates proves disastrous as the rumours goes around that he is an orphan. In order to boost his popularity, Henri pretends that he is the son of famous Tour de France hero, Raymond Poulidor, and that he can obtain autographs for everybody.

Credits: Producer, Denis Mermet ; director, writer, Serge Moati ; photography, Gerard de Battista ; music, Pierre Jansen.
Cast: Romain Bouteille, Elizabeth Wiener, David Benassayag.

results.title: Systems : an introduction / produced by BBC TV for Open University
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: An introduction to the concept of what a system is, what is meant by control of a system, a feedback and what are the laws of systems behavior

results.title: System 6: a fragile nest
results.creator_credit: CSIRO, Environmental Protection Authority, W A, ABC-TV (Australia), Craig Collie, Michael Daley and Jeni Kendell
results.brief_description: System 6 is the name given by the Environmental Protection Agency to the area around Perth. It includes the Darling Ranges and the Swan River System. The detrimental effect of the urban sprawl and industrialisation in the karri forests, on sand dunes, and under the sea, is examined. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Syrinx
results.brief_description: She was the nymph who found refuge in the river reeds when the goat-god Pan pursued her. Syrinx is the first film of Ryan Larkin, a young artist from Norman McLaren’s student group. To illustrate the ancient Greek legend of how Pan made his pipes, he employs various charcoal sketches. Accompanying music is Claude Debussy’s Syrinx for solo flute. (Awards: Addis Ababa, San Francisco, Montreal, Philadelphia)

constellations_primary.name: Cities under siege
constellations_primary.description: The Syrian Civil War is an ongoing conflict that is arguably the most documented in history, with images and videos captured by journalists, activists, combatants and victims.

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 4
results.brief_description: Volume 4 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The main folder contains material relating to the work of Stephen Jones. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Synthetics. Volume 2
results.brief_description: Volume 2 of a 4 volume CD-ROM collection of material compiled by Stephen Jones for the exhibition formally known as Synthetics. Content is arranged in folders and as a collection of texts, images and hypertexts. The folders contain material relating to the work of the following artists: Andrew Quinn, Ariel, David Chesworth, Doug Richardson, Iain MacLeod, Jeff Seidler, Jill Scott, Jon McCormack, Peter Callas, Sally Pryor, Tom Ellard and Wendy Spencer. (see: Documentation for details)

results.title: Synthetic fibers: nylon and rayon
results.brief_description: Illustrates how modern science and technology have made possible the development of new artificial fibres for making textiles - especially rayon and nylon. Shows some of the processes used in making these fibres, some of the ways in which they are useful to society and some of the characteristics of the textiles made from them.

results.title: Synthesis = Synthese. No. 6/77 [English language]
results.brief_description:
French cinemagazine items: Agronomy - general ecology, applied on site to vegetation, provides agronomists with valuable information on the natural environment with a view to its eventual development. To meet the needs of the consumer, agriculture has to increase plant production on a vast scale while maintaining conformity with the parent-plant and this is the subject of laboratory research; as is the improvement of species through genetic selection and hybridisation. Agronomical research in the fight against pests that damage crops, has turned to biological methods that are both specific and innocuous, as for example, in controlling caterpillars.
Suitable for senior students.
